SourcedStatement: The California Nurses Association (CNA), the largest union of registered nurses in the state, sponsored SB 1015 to support nursing students seeking placement in the workforce.
Name: California Nurses Association (CNA)
Justification: the largest union of registered nurses in the state

SourcedStatement: The bill authored by Sen. Dave Cortese (D-San Jose) aims to address the nursing shortage in the state’s workforce.
Name: Dave Cortese
Title: Sen.

SourcedStatement: Sen. Cortese said that SB 1015 ensures that the state meets the growing demand in the nursing field.
Name: Dave Cortese
Title: Sen.

SourcedStatement: “As California’s population ages and becomes increasingly more diverse, we will need a qualified and experienced nursing workforce to meet the unique demands and varied needs of all patients.
Name: Dave Cortese
Title: Sen.

SourcedStatement: That is why we must have appropriate nurse staffing levels which have proven to reduce mortality rates, reduce hospital length of stays, and reduce the number of preventable events such as falls and infections,” said Cortese.
Name: Dave Cortese
Title: Sen.

SourcedStatement: Cathy Kennedy, a Registered Nurse and president of the CNA, said that SB 1015 helps nursing students receive a clinical education and placement amid the nationwide staffing crisis, despite their socioeconomic background.
Name: Cathy Kennedy
Title: Registered Nurse and president
Justification: a Registered Nurse and president of the CNA

SourcedStatement: “Clinical education is an essential part of any nurse’s education, yet aspiring nurses, especially students in public programs, are being denied access to clinical placements,” said Kennedy.
Name: Cathy Kennedy
Title: Registered Nurse and president

SourcedStatement: “We applaud the California Senate for passing S.B. 1015.
Name: Cathy Kennedy
Title: Registered Nurse and president

SourcedStatement: It is commonsense reform that will increase transparency and increase oversight from the Board of Registered Nursing,” she added.
Name: Cathy Kennedy
Title: Registered Nurse and president

SourcedStatement: According to the Board of Registered Nursing, 92 out of 152 publicly funded nursing programs were denied access to clinic placements.
Name: Board of Registered Nursing
Justification: According to the Board of Registered Nursing

SourcedStatement: The program officials reported that the inability to secure clinical placements is one of the main reasons for not enrolling more students.
Name: Board of Registered Nursing
Justification: According to the Board of Registered Nursing

SourcedStatement: Nurses across California may soon have easier access to more career opportunities, if Gov. Gavin Newsom signs a new bill into law.
Name: Nurses

SourcedStatement: Under SB 1015, the State would ensure clinical placement opportunities for California’s future nurses, including nurses attending community colleges, state universities, and other public institutions.
